poem:
**Reform's Dawn**

A new wind stirs  
through hollow councils,  
shaking foundations  
of bureaucratic stone.  
Voices rise, rustling  
historic leaves,  
pledges whispered  
where silence slept.  
In the wake  
of unseen change,  
hope charts its course  
on lanes unseen,  
dreaming paths  
through England's  
ancient soil.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "From Send to cycle lanes, how Reform may try to change English councils Nigel Farage’s Reform UK is now in charge of a number of councils across England, including 10 where it has overall control. Its haul of 677 council seats also means it is on the brink of power in at least four others where it emerged as the largest party. It also has two regional mayoralties – Greater Lincolnshire and Hull and East". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
